* Tobacco and social inequalities
** Since 2000, daily smoking has fallen among the most disadvantaged smokers: from 38.8% in 2016 to 33.0% in 2018 (people on the lowest incomes), and from 49.7% to 40% (unemployed people).
** tobacco is a powerful social marker: in 2018, the higher the income, the lower the prevalence of daily smoking.

question.title: What is the trend in daily smoking prevalence among the most disadvantaged smokers in France since 2000?

option_a.title: The prevalence of daily smoking has increased among the most disadvantaged smokers
option_a.description: This option is plausible but incorrect

option_b.title: The prevalence of daily smoking has remained stable among the most disadvantaged smokers
option_b.description: This option is also plausible but incorrect

option_c.title: The prevalence of daily smoking has decreased among the most disadvantaged smokers

option_d.title: The prevalence of daily smoking has increased among the most disadvantaged smokers, especially among unemployed people
option_d.description: This option is plausible but incorrect, and it's a common misconception

correct_option.title: C
correct_option.description: This consists only a letter of the correct option
